> I haven't been able to verify this yet, but I bet this is because we cache the /api/v1/recipe endpoint, but we don't cache the /api/v1/recipe/signed endpoint.

Yeah, this is why #606 is happening; now that you added cache headers to the signed endpoint, the mock-server is caching the first test case it hits.

I put up #607 before remembering this PR existed. I don't have a test for comparing the signed and unsigned endpoints, and I don't do comparisons across all available testcases, so I'll see about integrating the work here into there.

Then the fix itself will be either disabling or bypassing the cache during mock-server runs.

Yeah, this is why #606 is happening; now that you added cache headers to the signed endpoint, the mock-server is caching the first test case it hits.

I put up #607 before remembering this PR existed. I don't have a test for comparing the signed and unsigned endpoints, and I don't do comparisons across all available testcases, so I'll see about integrating the work here into there.

Then the fix itself will be either disabling or bypassing the cache during mock-server runs.
